pullRequest.title: Add details to documentation on how to deploy to OpenShift and test the application
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added details on how to deploy to OpenShift using s2i and test.
Relates to: #11730

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            === Build and deply (in separate steps)
          
          
            
            === Build and Deploy (in separate steps)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -56,8 +57,15 @@ By adding this dependency, we now have the ability to configure the OpenShift re
 The configuration items that are available can be found in: `io.quarkus.kubernetes.deployment.OpenShiftConfig` class.
 Furthermore, the items provided by `io.quarkus.deployment.ApplicationConfig` affect the OpenShift resources.
 
-=== Building
+=== Build and deply (in separate steps)

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -90,19 +113,44 @@ or
 quarkus.container-image.builder=jib
 ----
 
-=== Deploying
+=== Build and Deploy (in a single step)
 
-To trigger a deployment:
+If OpenShift extension was not included during the bootstraping of the project nor added subsequently  (check pom.xml file for it), then add OpenShift as a dependency before building:

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The command above will build a jar file locally, subsequently trigger a container image build and then apply the generated OpenShift resources, right after.
          
          
            
            The aforementioned command will build a jar file locally, trigger a container image build and then apply the generated OpenShift resources.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -90,19 +113,44 @@ or
 quarkus.container-image.builder=jib
 ----
 
-=== Deploying
+=== Build and Deploy (in a single step)
 
-To trigger a deployment:
+If OpenShift extension was not included during the bootstraping of the project nor added subsequently  (check pom.xml file for it), then add OpenShift as a dependency before building:
+
+[source, subs=attributes+]
+----
+ ./mvnw quarkus:add-extension -Dextensions="openshift"
+----
+
+To trigger a build and deployment in a single step:
 
 [source, subs=attributes+]
 ----
 ./mvnw clean package -Dquarkus.kubernetes.deploy=true
 ----
 
-The command above will trigger a container image build and will apply the generated OpenShift resources, right after.
+The command above will build a jar file locally, subsequently trigger a container image build and then apply the generated OpenShift resources, right after.

nodes.bodyText: We should probably mention that this is optional
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,7 @@ To complete this guide, you need:
 * JDK 1.8+ installed with `JAVA_HOME` configured appropriately
 * Apache Maven {maven-version}
 * access to an OpenShift cluster (Minishift is a viable option)
+* OpenShift CLI

commit.message:
Updated deploying-to-openshift.adoc with details for how to build and
deploy.

beforeCommit.message: Merge branch 'deploy-to-openshift' of https://github.com/jackhu008/quarkus into deploy-to-openshift

afterCommit.message:
Updated deploying-to-openshift.adoc with details for how to build and
deploy.
